top_categories.workout_context: BWR Arizona's Desert gravel, Technical singletrack forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 104 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic BWR Arizona's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before February.
At mile 60 of 104, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
6,600ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
63ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At BWR Arizona, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
At BWR Arizona, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of BWR Arizona. Train it until it feels boring.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on desert gravel, singletrack, sand, rock. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 104 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 6,600ft of climbing on desert gravel, singletrack, sand, rock does to your power file on race day.
6,600ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for BWR Arizona’s 104 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at BWR Arizona. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at BWR Arizona demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride desert gravel, singletrack, sand, rock at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: desert gravel, technical singletrack, sand. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 104 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and Durability to prepare you for 104 miles of desert gravel, singletrack, sand, rock in Cave Creek / McDowell Region, Arizona.
